text:
Chainsaw currently doesn't maintain the selected line in the log panel when
applying a filter, even if the selected line passes the filter expression. It
selects some other line which is not relevant. Fixing this will help the user to
see whether the selected line is in the filtered output or not.
creator: isurues@gmail.com
isurues@gmail.com
text:
Created attachment 20619
Fixing line selection at filtering

In this patch I have fixed the bug and now it maintains the selected line in
the log panel if the selected line passes the filter expression. And also if
the selected line is not included in the new filtered set of log events (in
case of it is not passed), the last event is selected every time and it's
details are displayed in the 'event detail' panel.

I applied this patch locally and tested it, but it didn't quite work.

I ran the 'generator' from the tutorial and would occasionally get multiple rows
selected, and attempts to select a different row jumped back to the
previously-selected row.

Also, it'd be nice if the selection didn't 'jump' back to the last selected row.

I'll look into it and see if I can give some suggestions code-wise.
creator: sdeboy@iname.com

text:
Created attachment 20654
Improving the line selection fix

I reviewed this fix again and made some adjustments. Previous patch had a bug
when the user completely removes the filter after applying a filter (This mean
the filter text == "" situation). It was not selecting the event which was
selected with the filter on. I have fixed it in this patch.
I checked the fix with the generators in the tutorial. But it generates events
continuously and even if we select a particular event, it selects the last
event as new events come in. Because of that, we can't see the results even if
the fix works fine. So to check the fix I think we have to stop the generator
for a while and select a particular event and then play with it by applying
different filters. When I checked it that way, the fix works fine and it
maintains the selected line. I didn't come to a situation where it selects
multiple lines.
Actually the bug was due to only remembering the index in the table between
filters. So if the selected line is the index 5 in the table, it was
maintaining this index even if the filters are applied. As this index is not
related to the events, different event IDs was fitting to that index in the
table. That's why it was selecting rows without any relevance. In my fix I have
remembered the event ID of the selected event and that ID is selected after the
filter, if that ID is in the filtered result. If not the last event is
selected.
So that behavior of coming to the previously selected event even after 2 or 3
filters was due to above mentioned behavior and now it is fixed. I had missed
the scenario of coming back to the empty filter situation after a filter, in
the previous patch and it is fixed in this new patch.
Check it again and please comment if it doesn't behave as expected or if there
are more modifications to be done.

text:
It seems like there is already logic to deal with the temporary bypass of scroll
to bottom being disabled because the bottom line is not selected: via the
bypassScrollFind field.

Ideally, if the 'scroll to bottom' feature was enabled, a find would
-temporarily- disable it, as would a selection of a row other than the bottom row.

Then, if the bottom row was again selected (for example, via ctrl-end), scroll
to bottom would again behave as expected.

I experimented with updating the bypassscrollfind field and it worked relatively
well, but we'd need to update the bypass flag on the swing event dispatch thread
and make sure we check it before we programmatically scroll.
